verses.verse: In those days<WH3117> was Hezekiah<WH2396> sick<WH2470> unto death<WH4191>. And the prophet<WH5030> Isaiah<WH3470> the son<WH1121> of Amoz<WH531> came<WH935> to him, and said<WH559> unto him, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, Set thine house<WH1004> in order<WH6680>; for thou shalt die<WH4191>, and not live<WH2421>. Set: Heb. Give charge concerning thine house
Then he turned<WH5437> his face<WH6440> to the wall<WH7023>, and prayed<WH6419> unto the LORD<WH3068>, saying<WH559>,

I beseech<WH577> thee, O LORD<WH3068>, remember<WH2142> now how I have walked<WH1980> before<WH6440> thee in truth<WH571> and with a perfect<WH8003> heart<WH3824>, and have done<WH6213> that which is good<WH2896> in thy sight<WH5869>. And Hezekiah<WH2396> wept<WH1058> <WH1065> sore<WH1419>. sore: Heb. with a great weeping
And it came to pass, afore Isaiah<WH3470> was gone out<WH3318> into the middle<WH8484> court<WH2691> <WH5892>, that the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came to him, saying<WH559>, court: or, city

Turn again<WH7725>, and tell<WH559> Hezekiah<WH2396> the captain<WH5057> of my people<WH5971>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of David<WH1732> thy father<WH1>, I have heard<WH8085> thy prayer<WH8605>, I have seen<WH7200> thy tears<WH1832>: behold, I will heal<WH7495> thee: on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> thou shalt go up<WH5927> unto the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068>.

And I will add<WH3254> unto thy days<WH3117> fifteen<WH2568> <WH6240> years<WH8141>; and I will deliver<WH5337> thee and this city<WH5892> out of the hand<WH3709> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>; and I will defend<WH1598> this city<WH5892> for mine own sake, and for my servant<WH5650> David's<WH1732> sake.
And Isaiah<WH3470> said<WH559>, Take<WH3947> a lump<WH1690> of figs<WH8384>. And they took<WH3947> and laid<WH7760> it on the boil<WH7822>, and he recovered<WH2421>.

And Hezekiah<WH2396> said<WH559> unto Isaiah<WH3470>, What shall be the sign<WH226> that the LORD<WH3068> will heal<WH7495> me, and that I shall go up<WH5927> into the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>?

And Isaiah<WH3470> said<WH559>, This sign<WH226> shalt thou have of the LORD<WH3068>, that the LORD<WH3068> will do<WH6213> the thing<WH1697> that he hath spoken<WH1696>: shall the shadow<WH6738> go forward<WH1980> ten<WH6235> degrees<WH4609>, or go back<WH7725> ten<WH6235> degrees<WH4609>?

And Hezekiah<WH3169> answered<WH559>, It is a light thing<WH7043> for the shadow<WH6738> to go down<WH5186> ten<WH6235> degrees<WH4609>: nay, but let the shadow<WH6738> return<WH7725> backward<WH322> ten<WH6235> degrees<WH4609>.

And Isaiah<WH3470> the prophet<WH5030> cried<WH7121> unto the LORD<WH3068>: and he brought<WH7725> the shadow<WH6738> ten<WH6235> degrees<WH4609> backward<WH322>, by<WH4609> which it had gone down<WH3381> in the dial<WH4609> of Ahaz<WH271>. dial: Heb. degrees

At that time<WH6256> Berodachbaladan<WH1255>, the son<WH1121> of Baladan<WH1081>, king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, sent<WH7971> letters<WH5612> and a present<WH4503> unto Hezekiah<WH2396>: for he had heard<WH8085> that Hezekiah<WH2396> had been sick<WH2470>. Berodachbaladan: or, Merodachbaladan

And Hezekiah<WH2396> hearkened<WH8085> unto them, and shewed<WH7200> them all the house<WH1004> of his precious things<WH5238>, the silver<WH3701>, and the gold<WH2091>, and the spices<WH1314>, and the precious<WH2896> ointment<WH8081>, and all the house<WH1004> of his armour<WH3627>, and all that was found<WH4672> in his treasures<WH214>: there was nothing<WH1697> in his house<WH1004>, nor in all his dominion<WH4475>, that Hezekiah<WH2396> shewed<WH7200> them not. precious things: or, spicery armour: or, jewels: Heb. vessels

Then came<WH935> Isaiah<WH3470> the prophet<WH5030> unto king<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396>, and said<WH559> unto him, What said<WH559> these men<WH582>? and from whence<WH370> came<WH935> they unto thee? And Hezekiah<WH2396> said<WH559>, They are come<WH935> from a far<WH7350> country<WH776>, even from Babylon<WH894>.

And he said<WH559>, What have they seen<WH7200> in thine house<WH1004>? And Hezekiah<WH2396> answered<WH559>, All the things that are in mine house<WH1004> have they seen<WH7200>: there is nothing<WH1697> among my treasures<WH214> that I have not shewed<WH7200> them.
And Isaiah<WH3470> said<WH559> unto Hezekiah<WH2396>, Hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>.

Behold, the days<WH3117> come<WH935>, that all that is in thine house<WH1004>, and that which thy fathers<WH1> have laid up in store<WH686> unto this day<WH3117>, shall be carried<WH5375> into Babylon<WH894>: nothing<WH1697> shall be left<WH3498>, saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>.

And of thy sons<WH1121> that shall issue<WH3318> from thee, which thou shalt beget<WH3205>, shall they take away<WH3947>; and they shall be eunuchs<WH5631> in the palace<WH1964> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>.

Then said<WH559> Hezekiah<WH2396> unto Isaiah<WH3470>, Good<WH2896> is the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> which thou hast spoken<WH1696>. And he said<WH559>, Is it not good, if peace<WH7965> and truth<WH571> be in my days<WH3117>? Is it: or, Shall there not be peace and truth, etc

And the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Hezekiah<WH2396>, and all his might<WH1369>, and how he made<WH6213> a pool<WH1295>, and a conduit<WH8585>, and brought<WH935> water<WH4325> into the city<WH5892>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the chronicles<WH1697> <WH3117> of the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>?
And Hezekiah<WH2396> slept<WH7901> with his fathers<WH1>: and Manasseh<WH4519> his son<WH1121> reigned<WH4427> in his stead.
